data.meta_description: Read all of the posts by thegalaaffair on The Gala Affair
data.text:
Scooby-Doo, Where Are You?

Scooby-Doo, Where Are You?, an American animated mystery comedy series, originally released in 1969-70, was one of the first few cartoons to be aired on Cartoon Network in 1990s. The series featured four teenagers – Fred Jones, Daphne Blake, Velma Dinkley and Norville Rogers (better known as Shaggy), and their semi-anthropomorphic dog, Scooby-Doo, who traveled in a van named the Mystery Machine and solved mysteries involving several local legends and of supposedly supernatural creatures through a series of antics and missteps.

Tom and Jerry

Tom and Jerry, an American animated series of short films created in 1940, was first aired on Cartoon Network in 1996. The show revolved around the rivalry of its two leads, Tom, the cat, and Jerry, the mouse, and was based around slapstick comedy. Watching Tom and Jerry’s cute fights gave immense pleasure to people of all ages.

Looney Tunes

Looney Tunes, commonly mistaken as Looney Toons, is an American series of comedy short films produced from 1930-1969. Looney Tunes and its related cartoons were first aired on Cartoon Network in 1997. Looney Tunes was known for introducing the famous cartoon characters like Bugs Bunny, Tweety, Daffy Duck, Road Runner, Sylvester, etc., in its various short films.

Dexter’s Laboratory

Dexter’s Laboratory, an American comic science fiction animated TV series created for Cartoon Network, is the first of the network’s Cartoon Cartoons and was introduced in 1999. The show’s lead Dexter happens to be a boy-genius and inventor with a secret laboratory in the basement of his house. He constantly has to battle his sister, Dee Dee, to keep her away from the lab. Dexter also engages in a bitter rivalry with his neighbor and fellow genius Mandark.

Dexter’s Laboratory received widespread critical acclaim and high ratings and became one of Cartoon Network’s most popular and successful original series.

Johnny Bravo

Johnny Bravo, an American animated TV series, created for Cartoon Network, was the second of network’s Cartoon Cartoons and was also introduced in 1999. The series revolves on the title character, Johnny, a muscular and boorish young man who tries to get women to date him, though he is usually unsuccessful and ends up in a bizarre situations and predicaments. The show, throughout its run, was controversial for its adult humor, pop culture references and sly adult-oriented jokes.

The Powerpuff Girls

The Powerpuff Girls, an American superhero animated TV series, was also created for Cartoon Network and was introduced in 2000. The show revolves around the three sisters, Blossom, Bubbles and Buttercup, collectively known as The Powerpuff Girls as they have superpowers, and their father, Professor Utonium, a brainy scientist who all live in the city of Townsville. The girls are frequently called upon by the town’s mayor to help fight the nearby criminals using their powers.

The Powerpuff Girls, Blossom, Bubble and Buttercup, were created by Professor Utonium in an attempt to create the “perfect little girl” using a mixture of “sugar, spice and everything nice“. However, he accidentally spilled a mysterious substance called “Chemical X” into the mixture while creating the three girls and thus, granting superpowers to all the three.

Courage the Cowardly Dog

Courage The Cowardly Dog, an American animated horror comedy TV series, was also created for Cartoon Network as a part of the network’s Cartoon Cartoons block and was introduced in 2000. The lead of the show, Courage, is a pink anthropomorphic dog, who lives with an elderly couple in the middle of nowhere. The trio is frequently thrown into bizarre misadventures, often involving the supernatural or paranormal. The series is known for its dark, surreal humor and atmosphere.

The Popeye Show

The Popeye Show, an animated anthology series, was premiered on Cartoon Network in November, 2001. The show revolved around the title character, Popeye, his girl friend, Olive and the villain, Brutus. Popeye is known to have spinach and gain the power to fight all the bad (Brutus in some of its episodes).

~Priyal Murdia

Siddiqui summoned by cops in the Thane CDR case

Siddiqui is known for his off-beat films and outstanding acting prowess and is one of the most sought-after actors of Bollywood. After triggering controversy with his biography, An Ordinary Life: A Memoir, actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui has once again hogged the limelight, for all the wrong reasons.

In a fresh twist in the Thane CDR (Call Data Records) case, the city police’s Crime Branch summoned Siddiqui for investigations. The Thane police on Friday said that they had summoned actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui, his wife and a lawyer in connection with investigations into the Call Detail Record (CDR) scam that was unearthed in January.

The acclaimed award-winning actor was allegedly accused of spying on his wife and his name surfaced when Thane Police nabbed around 11 accused, mostly private detectives who were involved in the CDR Scam.

“One of the accused has revealed Siddiqui’s name during interrogation. We have issued summons to him, but he has failed to appear before us for investigations,” said Nitin Thakare, Senior Inspector, Thane Crime Branch on Friday.

The accused have revealed the names of several other Bollywood personalities, businessmen and even politicians who are likely to be probed soon, investigators said. However, they cannot reveal names until the investigation is completed. Police will be able to provide further information after recording Nawaz’s statement.

~Priyal Murdia

“Kasautiiiii Zindagiii kayyyy…” and then the music fades away!

Yes you are not dreaming! Queen of television, Ekta Kapoor, has dropped massive hints that she is going to bring her most desired, “long lasting” 9 year-aired show back on T.V. This daily soap was an amazing and must-watched shows for all the romantic couples and the people living in a love-driven fairy land because of the lead actress Prerna (Shweta Tiwari) and the lead actor Anurag Basu (Cezzane Khan) showing and sharing a deep emotional connection with a beautiful strong chemistry.

How did we come to know?

The queen has shared a tweet in which she was talking about bringing back one of her glorified shows bankrolled by her own Balaji Motion Pictures. Lets take a look at her tweet:

Ekta Kapoor

✔@ektaravikapoor

With a piece of my broken heart I wrote in 2001,17 years later I Reboot it dipping in personal pain & lacing it with experiences of an older me! Bringing back my most successful love saga that ran for 9 yrs! Again I’ll take my broken heart & make it into art! #NamesToBeAnnounced

The producer wrote, ”With a piece of my broken heart I wrote in 2001, 17 years later I Reboot it dipping in personal pain & lacing it with experiences of an older me! Bringing back my most successful love saga that ran for 9 yrs! Again I’ll take my broken heart & make it into art! #NamesToBeAnnounced.” Soon, after she posted the tweet, fans began speculating about her hit shows.

Well, let’s have a look at running time of some of her popular shows. Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi was on air from 2000-2008, Kahaani Ghar Ghar Kii also aired during the same time period. But, it was Kasautii which was launched in 2001 and went off air in 2009, thus making it a nine-year run.

Even though what facts are portraying, fans are still having their wild guesses in the comments section. No one knows what is going in the queen’s mind but, however, if it is about Kasautii, everyone is hoping and excited to see Shweta Tiwari and Anurag Basu’s love story back on screen.

-Naman Binani

Billy Joel’s song Only The Good Die Young is an amazing track to listen to. But in reality, the words of that line are haunting.

Death is inevitable, we have been told that time and again. But when a life is lost, the universal truth of death does not provide much solace.

Here are 7 famous Indian Celebrities, who died an unexpected death.

1. Ishmeet Singh (2 September, 1988 – 29 July, 2008)

Ishmeet won the Star Plus show Amul STAR Voice of India in 2007 and also participated in another reality show called Jo Jeeta Wohi Superstar. His first album was a religious Gurbani album called Satgur Tumre Kaaj Savaare. He died by suspected drowning in Maldives on 29 July, 2008.

2. Taruni Suchdev (14 May, 1998 – 14 May, 2012)

Taruni, better known as the “Rasna Girl”, was an Indian model and child actress known for her work in television advertisements and flims. She was one of the busiest child models in the industry. She has acted beside Amitabh Bachchan, Abhishek Bachchan and Vidya Balan in the Hindi film Paa in 2009. She also starred in two Malayalam films and was the highest paid child artist of her time. She also acted in a Tamil serial and the famous Hindi serial Sasural Simar Ka.

Taruni died in the Agni Air Flight CHT plane crash in Nepal on 14 May, 2012. Before she left for the Nepal trip, she hugged all her friends and said, “I’m meeting you guys for the last time.” Though it was a light-hearted joke but according to her classmates she had never hugged her friends or sent them goodbye messages before leaving for any of her earlier trips. The last message Taruni sent before boarding the flight was to her best friend where she jokingly asked what would happen if the plane crashed followed by “I love you.” Her friends believe that it was written in her destiny to die on that plane.

3. Jiah Khan (born Nafisa Rizvi Khan) (20 February, 1988 – 3 June 2013)

Jiah was a British-American actress and singer who appeared in Bollywood films from 2007-2010. She made her film debut in Ram Gopal Verma’s Nishabd in 2007, later portrayed a modern independent woman in Ghajini in 2008 and her final film appearance was in Sajid Khan’s romantic comedy Housefull in 2010. She had captured herself into the Bollywood 100 Crore Club with Ghajini and Housefull.

On June 3, 2013 she was found hanging from the ceiling fan of her bedroom of her family’s residence in Juhu. Sooraj Pancholi, who was allegedly in a live-in relationship with Jiah, was suspected for her murder. But on 1 August, 2016 CBI ruled out the murder case. But later a British forensics expert concluded that Jiah’s hanging was staged and the marks on her face and neck indicated that it was not a simple suicide.

4. Sandeep Acharya (4 February, 1984 – 15 December, 2013)

Sandeep got his fame after winning the second season of the popular reality television show Indian Idol in 2006. He also made an appearance in the romantic drama series Kaisa Ye Pyar Hai on Sony TV. Acharya died of Jaundice on 15 December, 2013.

5. Pratyusha Banerjee (10 August, 1991 – 1 April, 2016)

Pratyusha was an Indian television actress and appeared in numerous television and reality shows. She gained her initial recognition from her first lead role as “Anandi” in the famous daily soap Balika Vadhu in 2010. She had also participated in the famous controversial reality show Big Boss 7 in 2013. She had also participated in Jhalak Dikhla Jaa (season 5) and played important roles in Hum Hain Na, Sasural Simar Ka and Gulmohar Grand.

She was found hanging in her Mumbai apartment on 1 April, 2016. The reason behind her suicide is believed to be her complicated relationship with boyfriend Rahul Raj.

6. Reema Lagoo (21 June, 1958 – 18 May, 2017)

Reema was an Indian theater and screen actress known for her work in Hindi and Marathi cinema. She started her career on Marathi stage. She was the epitome of motherhood in Bollywood films. She shot to fame in the 80s hit Maine Pyar Kiya. She has also starred in some of the biggest hits of Bollywood including Hum Saath Saath Hai, Hum Aapke Hain Kaun, Kuch Kuch Hota Hai, Kal Ho Na Ho, etc. She was also casted in the daily soap Tu Tu Main Main on Star Plus.

Lagoo died of cardiac arrest on 18 May, 2017. She was described as “perfectly fine” and having “no health issues” at the time of her death.

7. Sridevi (born Shree Amma Yanger Ayyapan) (13 August, 1963 – 24 Feb 2018)

Sridevi was an Indian actress and film producer who starred in Tamil, Telugu, Hindi, Malayalam and Kannada films. She was ranked among the highest-paid actors in 1980s and 1990s and is considered as Bollywood’s “first female superstar”. She made her first debut at the age of 4 and started her acting career in lead role as a child. She made her Hindi film debut as a child artist in 1972 and played her first adult role in a Tamil film at the age of 13. Sridevi established herself as one of the leading actresses of Tamil and Telugu cinema. Her first starring role in Hindi cinema was in 1979 but her role besides Jeetendra in Himmatwala (1983) helped her gain wide recognition.

Sridevi was awarded the Padma Shri for her contributions to the entertainment industry in 2013 by the Government of India. State governments of Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh and Kerala conferred Honourary awards on her. She was also voted “India’s Greatest Actresses in 100 Years” in a CNN-IBN national poll conducted on the occation of the century on the Indian Cinema in 2013. She was married to the film producer Boney Kapoor in 1996 and had two daughters Jhanvi and Khushi.

Sridevi was found dead on 24 February, 2018 in her hotel room in Dubai. Although, earlier it was announced that the cause of death was a cardiac arrest, the forensic report released by Dubai Police indicated that she died of accidental drowning in the bathtub of the hotel room.

~Priyal Murdia
